001package utilities;
002
003import java.awt.Point;
004import java.awt.Polygon;
005import java.awt.Shape;
006import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
007import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
008
009/**
010 *
011 * @author Borja Zarco
012 */
013public class Arrow {
014
015    public static Shape createArrowShape(Point2D fromPt, Point2D toPt) {
016        Polygon arrowPolygon = new Polygon();
017        arrowPolygon.addPoint(4,1);
018        arrowPolygon.addPoint(8,0);
019        arrowPolygon.addPoint(4,-1);
020
021
022        Point2D midPoint = midpoint(fromPt, toPt);
023
024        double rotate = Math.atan2(toPt.getY() - fromPt.getY(), toPt.getX() - fromPt.getX());
025
026        AffineTransform transform = new AffineTransform();
027        transform.translate(midPoint.getX(), midPoint.getY());
028        double ptDistance = fromPt.distance(toPt);
029        double scale = ptDistance / 24.0; // 12 because it's the length of the arrow polygon.
030        transform.scale(scale, scale);
031        transform.rotate(rotate);
032
033        return transform.createTransformedShape(arrowPolygon);
034    }
035
036    private static Point2D midpoint(Point2D p1, Point2D p2) {
037        return new Point2D.Double((p1.getX() + p2.getX()) / 2.0, (p1.getY() + p2.getY()) / 2.0);
038    }
039}
